brand_info.name: Under Armour
brand_info.positioning: Performance-driven sportswear and footwear brand focused on innovation, training culture, and functional solutions designed to improve athletic performance.
brand_info.vision: To inspire you with performance solutions you never knew you needed and can’t imagine living without.
brand_info.origin_story: Founded in 1996 by Kevin Plank, who started the company with moisture-wicking performance apparel designed to solve the problem of sweat-soaked cotton shirts in training and competition.

brand_values.brand_promise: Relentless performance gear and footwear engineered to help athletes train harder, recover smarter, and compete better.
differentiators: Performance-first product engineering (materials, fit, sweat management, temperature regulation)
Training culture and athlete mindset as core brand narrative
Bold, high-energy creative rooted in sport, effort, and measurable improvement
non_negotiables: Functional product integrity and technical authenticity
Intensity and drive without fake hype

psychographics.lifestyle: Training-centric people who value performance, discipline, sport identity, and functional gear for gym, field, court, and outdoor activities
psychographics.behavior: Buys for training and sport use cases, prefers proven performance features, follows athletes/teams, repeats purchases of core training items and footwear franchises

tone_of_voice.communication_style: Action-led and performance-claim-driven with training language, short imperative lines, and athlete mindset cues
avoid: Abstract lifestyle poetry without performance anchors
tone_dos: Back claims with product features or athlete proof
Keep the message bold and concise

logo.primary_logo: Interlocking UA monogram (Under Armour logo) typically rendered in black or white for high contrast
logo.usage_rules: Keep the monogram crisp and high-contrast; never distort; avoid cluttered placement that reduces legibility
logo.lockup_behavior: Often used as a strong end-card stamp or a small corner marker; can be paired with bold type in clean lockups
logo.safe_area: Minimum padding equals at least the width of one monogram stroke around the mark

color_system.color_usage_rules: High-contrast black and white system as default; red used as an energy accent; sport-specific color pops may appear as product accents while brand base remains monochrome-forward

typography.primary_font: Bold modern sans-serif (athletic, condensed-to-standard proportions depending on campaign system)

spacing.letter_spacing: Slightly tight for impact in headlines; neutral for body readability

layout_principles.grid_system: Strong grid with athletic poster logic and clear hierarchy
layout_principles.white_space_ratio: Medium (purposeful negative space used for impact and clarity)
layout_principles.image_vs_text_balance: Image-led with bold headline overlays or clean end-cards; product feature callouts when needed
layout_principles.cta_placement: Lower third or end-card; clean and direct
layout_principles.alignment: Often left-aligned or centered for strength; consistent baseline alignment for type blocks

preferred_photographers: Varies by sport and market; consistent performance advertising language across global campaigns
style.camera_feel: High-energy sport realism with controlled dramatization and strong subject emphasis
style.pose_guidelines: Training and competition actions; exertion visible; athletic posture; purposeful stance; moments of effort and focus
style.casting_attitude: Athletes and sport-credible talent; competitive mindset; confidence without glamour posing

technical.lighting: High-contrast studio or dramatic directional light; stadium/gym practicals; strong rim or edge separation when appropriate
technical.grain: Low to moderate depending on grit level of the campaign
technical.depth_of_field: Shallow to medium to isolate athlete and product while preserving environment cues
technical.color_grading: Punchy blacks, clean highlights, controlled saturation; red accents and sport colors kept vivid but contained

model_casting.diversity: High; representative casting across sports and communities

product_presentation.hero_visibility: Product features and fit must read clearly in motion and close-up details
product_presentation.styling_approach: Performance gear worn correctly for the sport; minimal styling noise; sport-appropriate accessories only
avoid: Fashion-only styling that breaks sport credibility
Overly polished lifestyle scenes that remove training context
Crowded backgrounds that hide product and athlete form

motion_rules.pacing: Fast, punchy cuts with moments of slow emphasis on impact points (landing, strike, lift, sprint)
motion_rules.transitions: Hard cuts, match cuts, minimal gimmicks; occasional kinetic typography or graphic wipes when aligned to campaign system

visual_dos: Use high-contrast lighting with clear subject separation
Feature product performance details in action
Maintain sport credibility in environment and styling
visual_donts: Soft lifestyle mood that removes performance tension
copy_dos: Use challenge language and action verbs
Keep claims grounded in performance features
Let athletes and training moments act as proof
copy_donts: Claims that cannot be supported by product performance

must_remain: Training culture intensity and athlete credibility
can_evolve: Seasonal color accents tied to product lines
test_zone: New sport franchises and grassroots programs
Collaboration capsules that still retain performance DNA

materials: Bold wall graphics and athlete imagery
interactive_elements: Sport category zoning and hero franchises

digital.tone_adjustment: More technical feature callouts and training utility online; short motivational headlines on social

platform_behavior.Instagram: Athlete action, training clips, bold headline overlays, franchise drops
platform_behavior.Website: Product-first with performance technology explanations, fit guidance, sport filters, and clear CTAs
platform_behavior.Newsletter: Franchise and athlete-led drops, product innovations, direct training value propositions

print.paper: Commercial stock with strong ink density for blacks and crisp logo reproduction
print.cover_rules: Athlete or product hero with bold headline, high contrast, and clear UA mark placement

logo_misuse_examples: Logo placed over cluttered textures reducing legibility
Unauthorized recolors that weaken brand contrast system
